Package utils.blocking

Class BlockingArrayDeque<T>

java.lang.Object
utils.blocking.BlockingArrayDeque<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements to store in the deque
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, BlockingDeque<T>
public class BlockingArrayDeque<T> extends Object implements BlockingDeque<T>
A blocking ArrayDeque that can be used as both a stack and queue, and can be optionally circular and/or bounded. For using it as a stack methods push() and pop() are recommended. For queue functionality methods enqueue() and dequeue() are recommended.
Version:
1.0.0 - May 2024
Author:
Alexandru Tofan
See Also:

      A constructor that can be used to create a bounded deque
      Parameters:
      circular - if the deque should be circular
      capacity - maximum capacity of the deque

      A constructor that can be used to create an unbounded deque
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • push

      public boolean push(T element)
      Pushes an element to the front of the deque, unless the deque is bounded and full. This should be used for stack functionality as it pushes an element to the front (top) of the deque.
      Specified by:
      push in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Parameters:
      element - the element to push
      Returns:
      true if the element was pushed or false otherwise

    • pop

      public T pop()
      Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. This should be used for stack functionality as it pops the element at the front (top) of the deque.
      Specified by:
      pop in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Returns:
      the front element or null if the deque is empty

    • enqueue

      public boolean enqueue(T element)
      Inserts the specified element at the end of this deque unless it would violate capacity restrictions.
      Specified by:
      enqueue in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Parameters:
      element - the element to enqueue
      Returns:
      true if the element was added to this deque, else false

    • dequeue

      public T dequeue()
      Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. If circular was set to true then this would enqueue the element after dequeue putting it at the tail of this deque thus making it circular.
      Specified by:
      dequeue in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Returns:
      the head of this deque, or null if this deque is empty

    • peek

      public T peek()
      Retrieves, but does not remove, the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. In case of using this deque as a stack, this returns the top element of the stack.
      Specified by:
      peek in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Returns:
      the head of this deque, or null if this deque is empty

    • remove

      public boolean remove(T element)
      Removes the first occurrence of the given element from this deque.
      Specified by:
      remove in interface BlockingDeque<T>
      Parameters:
      element - the element to remove
      Returns:
      true if an element has been removed
